alert.note: Alert for Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 7:38PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River near Harlem affecting Blaine County. Big Sandy Creek at Havre affecting Hill County. For the Milk River...including Harlem...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Big Sandy Creek...including Havre...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sandy Creek at Havre. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM MDT Thursday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.0 feet early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.3 feet on 04/12/1965. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1000 AM MDT.
